instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 that has about 0.3v in SMC_BC_ACOK
threads.message: Good morning, I have a 820-2936 that has about 0.3v in SMC_BC_ACOK, is smc dead or u7000?

threads.title: 820-2936 that has about 0.3v in SMC_BC_ACOK
threads.message: First the basic voltages on U7000. Is DCIN present is 3V42 even present?

threads.title: 820-2936 that has about 0.3v in SMC_BC_ACOK
threads.message: it's present, heating SMC area the board started to work again, so I supposed it was a dead smc. I replaced the smc and still same problem. Boards boot only heating smc area

threads.title: 820-2936 that has about 0.3v in SMC_BC_ACOK
threads.message: Pull up resistor on ACOK line bad?

threads.title: 820-2936 that has about 0.3v in SMC_BC_ACOK
threads.message: please, can you tell which resistor should I check?  r6929 is 2k

threads.title: 820-2936 that has about 0.3v in SMC_BC_ACOK
threads.message: when smc area cools down magsafe light turns off

threads.title: 820-2936 that has about 0.3v in SMC_BC_ACOK
threads.message: Sorry problem not solved. smc_BC_ACOK is 1.4v instead of 3v. chgr_ACIN is present, already replaced u7000 2 times.  If I press with a finger under u7000 area boards boots even if smc_BC_ACOK is low

threads.title: 820-2936 that has about 0.3v in SMC_BC_ACOK
threads.message: Value of R5087 and resistance to GND on the ACOK line?
